title.value: Single-cell analysis reveals inﬂammatory interactions driving macular degeneration
title.justification: The title is clearly mentioned in the paper's heading and throughout the text.
title.quote: Single-cell analysis reveals inﬂammatory interactions driving macular degeneration

extractions.description: This paper uses single-nucleus RNA sequencing to profile lesions from human retinas with age-related macular degeneration (AMD) and applies a machine-learning pipeline called CATCH to identify activated glial populations, suggesting a mechanism of disease progression similar across various neurodegenerative conditions.

type.justification: The paper presents data from experiments including single-nucleus RNA sequencing of human retina samples, computational analyses, and biological validations.
type.quote: Here we use single-nucleus RNA sequencing to proﬁle lesions from 11 postmortem human retinas with age-related macular degeneration and 6 control retinas with no history of retinal disease. We create a machine-learning pipeline based on recent advances in data geometry and topology and identify activated glial populations enriched in the early phase of disease.

name.justification: The paper focuses on neural cells and neurodegenerative diseases, specifically investigating retinal degeneration in relation to the central nervous system.
name.quote: As parts of the central nervous system (CNS), the retina contains many different functional layers and distinct strata that are occupied by a highly diverse set of cell types and states.

name.justification: The primary focus of the study is to understand the mechanisms contributing to AMD through single-cell analysis.
name.quote: AMD is a neurodegenerative disease of the retina that affects 196 million individuals worldwide and has a significant impact on patient’s quality of life

name.justification: The findings from AMD are extended to other neurodegenerative diseases, examining commonalities in mechanisms across ailments like Alzheimer’s disease and progressive multiple sclerosis.
name.quote: we developed a topologically inspired machine-learning suite of tools called Cellular Analysis with Topology and Condensation Homology (CATCH)... By reapplying our pipeline to AD and MS single-cell datasets, we identified the same signatures in the early phases of multiple neurodegenerative diseases, indicating a common mechanism for glial activation in the early phase of neurodegeneration.

name.justification: The CATCH model is the primary machine-learning pipeline used in this study to analyze the single-cell transcriptomic data.
name.quote: we developed a topologically inspired machine-learning suite of tools called Cellular Analysis with Topology and Condensation Homology (CATCH).

aliases: Cellular Analysis with Topology and Condensation Homology

is_contributed.justification: The CATCH model was developed as part of this study to better understand the data collected from single-cell RNA sequencing.
is_contributed.quote: To address this, we developed a topologically inspired machine-learning suite of tools called Cellular Analysis with Topology and Condensation Homology (CATCH).

is_executed.justification: The CATCH model was used in the study for data analysis and identification of disease-enriched populations.
is_executed.quote: To quantify the effect of experimental perturbations in single-cell RNA-sequencing data using graph signal processing.

is_compared.justification: The performance of the CATCH model is compared to traditional clustering methods like Louvain and Leiden in the paper.
is_compared.quote: We benchmarked our CATCH approach against existing clustering strategies applied to single-cell data.

referenced_paper_title.quote: The diffusion condensation method, used in the CATCH pipeline, was established and used to identify multigranular structure in biomedical datasets.

name.justification: The dataset comprises single-nucleus RNA sequencing data from 11 postmortem human retinas with AMD and 6 control retinas.
name.quote: we performed massively parallel microfluidics-based single nucleus RNA-sequencing (snRNA-seq) to create a single-cell transcriptomic dataset of AMD pathology, comprising 70,973 cells across multiple stages of disease.

name.quote: Examining single-cell data from Alzheimer’s disease and progressive multiple sclerosis with our pipeline, we find a similar glial activation profile enriched in the early phase of these neurodegenerative diseases.

name.quote: Batch correction was performed using Harmony to align batch effects introduced by sequencing batch, postmortem interval, sample acquisition location and 10X sequencing chemistry.
